page.title: 01Clapham and Oakley
page.content:
This area has been studied by Ursula Taylor Lower School and Lincroft Middle school, with contributions from Oakley Lower School. It covers two villages and the countryside in between and around them.
Clapham is situated on the main A6 road and it has just been announced that there will be a Clapham By-pass in the near future. Oakley is a mile further to the West. The villages are surrounded by agricultural land, with woods, the River Ouse and a main railway line on the outskirts.
The main buildings of consequence are the two village churches, and Clapham church has a fine Saxon tower which can be seen from a distance dominating the area.
